document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of Eupholus Boisduval (Coleoptera, Curculionidae, Entiminae) from West New Guinea, a discussion of their taxonomic characters, and notes on nomenclature

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of Eupholus Boisduval (Coleoptera, Curculionidae, Entiminae) from West New Guinea, a discussion of their taxonomic characters, and notes on nomenclature

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype : IRIAN JAYA , Jayawijaya Prov., Membahan (near Kosarek), 1500­1800 m ,
23 .IX. 1991
, leg. A.Riedel & native collectors ( MZB ) [pinned through right elytron; genitalia dissected, in glycerol / microvial attached to pin; left ala cut at base, on cardboard attached to pin]. Paratypes : IRIAN JAYA , Jayawijaya Prov.:
26 males
,
19 females
( 1 marked as "allotype"), same data as holotype ( ARC , MZB , UNSM , ZSM ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 9­13. Male genitalia of
E. schneideri
: (9) aedeagus in glycerol, holotype, dorsal aspect; (10) aedeagus in glycerol, holotype, lateral aspect; (11) dry body of aedeagus, paratype, dorsal aspect; (12) transfer apparatus of holotype in glycerol, resting position; (12) dry transfer apparatus of paratype, everted position.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Allotype, female (
Fig. 2
). Same as holotype except: Length . Total length 27.0 mm; pronotum + elytron 20.0 mm. Rostrum 1.81 X as long as wide at base; maximum width in front of antennal insertion 1.28 X width at base. Antenna . Funicle + club 2.36 X length of scape. Pronotum 1.14 X wider than long; glabrous median band wider, about as wide as diameter of eye. Elytron 3.06 X longer than wide between humeri; greatest width at middle, 1.11 X wider than between humeri. Interval 5 at apical third with obtuse tubercle. Areas of orange color more intense: band behind humerus constricted at middle; interval 3 without spot; transverse band in apical third straight. Abdomen . Anterior margin of sternites III­VIII glabrous. Genitalia . Sternite VIII as in fig. 21 . Hemisternite (
Fig. 22
) 2.3 X as long as high, apical half trapezoid, apically subtruncate. Stylus 2.0 X as long as wide, subapically with cluster of moderately long stiff setae pointing laterad. Vagina ( Fig. 14, 17 ) with median sclerite and pair of larger lateral sclerites ca. twice as long as wide. Ductus spermathecae thin, isodiametric, inserted at junction of bursa copulatrix and oviduct; terminal portion of bursa dorsally anterior of this junction. Spermatheca ( Figs. 16 , 24 ) with gland ca.
3 X
as long as body. Eggs [two well developed eggs taken from paratype ] ovate, 4.8 mm X 2.3 mm , longitudinally wrinkled.

Intraspecific variation. Length . Total length of males 19.0­23.0 mm ( 26 , 20.8 ± 1.2 ) (= number of specimens, average ± standard deviation), females 21.0­27.0 mm ( 19 , 23.1 ± 1.3 ); pronotum + elytron of males 14.7 ­18.0 mm ( 26 , 16.2 ± 1.0), females 16.5 ­20.0 mm ( 19 , 18.4 ± 0.8 ). Coloration either of rather greenish shade or bluish turquoise; with patterns of either deep orange color, or of rather pale ferruginous color. Head with lateral glabrous patch behind eye more or less extensive, but always distinct. Rostrum in males 1.91­2.16 X as long as wide at base ( 25 , 2.04 ± 0.08 ), in females 1.76­2.06 X as long as wide at base ( 18 , 1.89 ± 0.08 ); maximum width in front of antennal insertion 1.36 X width at base ( 44 , 1.36 ± 0.06 ). Antenna . Funicle + club 2.41­2.79 X length of scape in males ( 12 , 2.60 ± 0.12 ), 2.22­2.68 X length of scape in females ( 11 , 2.43 ± 0.13 ). Pronotum 1.05­1.17 X wider than long in males ( 27 , 1.10 ± 0.03 ), 1.09­1.23 X wider than long in females ( 18 , 1.14 ± 0.04 ). Median glabrous band usually subequal in width to antennal funicle; in some specimens 0.5 X as wide as antennal funicle and abbreviated anteriorly, in other specimens
3 X
as wide as antennal funicle. Scutellum usually covered by elytra, rarely vestige exposed. Elytron in males 3.08­3.47 X longer than wide between humeri ( 26 , 3.30 ± 0.11 ), in females 3.04­3.29 X longer than wide between humeri ( 19 , 3.16 ± 0.08 ); greatest width in males 1.02­1.15 X wider than between humeri ( 26 , 1.08 ± 0.03 ), in females 1.08­1.20 X wider than between humeri ( 19 , 1.12 ± 0.03 ). Obtuse swelling of interval 5 more or less distinct, generally more marked in females than in males. Rectangular projection of humerus more or less distinct, generally more marked in females than in males. Sutural interval usually glabrous black in basal half; rarely glabrous area limited to basal 1 / 3 , or extended beyond middle. Extent of orange colored areas variable: minimally limited to ridge of interval 7 in basal half and to swelling of interval 5 in apical third (
Fig. 4
); an additional spot may be added on interval 3 which may fuse with the one on interval 5 ; in some specimens a complete transverse band is formed in apical 1 / 3 ; in many specimens the orange coloration of interval 7 is extended mesad to intervals 6 ­ 4 . Ala . Length 15.3­18.3 mm ( 4 , 17.5 ± 1.5 ). Genitalia . Sternite VIII weakly sclerotized in allotype, darker in some other specimens; dorsal lateral folds of apical plate in some specimens more approximated than in allotype. Body of spermatheca of extremely variable shape, as in figs. 24­26 .

This species is closely related to
E. kotaseaoi (Porion)
, the only other known species of
Eupholus
with intense orange colored sides of the pronotum. From the habitus illustration given by
Porion ( 2000 )
following differences between the species can be noted:
E. kotaseaoi (Porion)
E. schneideri
sp. n.

orange coloration of sides of pronotum
continued on elytron humeri; usually in apical third

tr.td: with additional orange spots / a transverse band

This species is named in honor of Dr. med. Wolfgang Axel Schneider (Kempten / Allgäu). This patronym is seen as a small service in return to Mr. Schneider´s most generous support of systematic research and conservation of biodiversity through his donation to BIOPAT e. V..
